events.name: Hackathon
events.title: Coding Challenge
events.description: 24-hour coding challenge to build innovative solutions

details.fullDescription: To all the innovators out there, PARADOX '25 presents the ultimate coding challenge where you can showcase your problem-solving skills and creativity.

guidelines.title: Tools
guidelines.content: Any programming language, framework, or tools can be used

guidelines.title: Theme
guidelines.content: Problem statement will be revealed at the start

guidelines.title: Evaluation Criteria
guidelines.content: Innovation, Technical Implementation, UI/UX, and Presentation

guidelines.title: Submission
guidelines.content: Code repository and demo video required

details.fullDescription: Join us for insightful sessions by leading professionals who will share their expertise and guide you through the latest trends in technology.

guidelines.title: Topics
guidelines.content: AI, Machine Learning, Cloud Computing, Cybersecurity

guidelines.title: Networking
guidelines.content: Opportunity to connect with industry professionals

guidelines.title: Materials
guidelines.content: Presentation slides and resources will be shared

details.tagline: Battle with algorithms and data structures
details.fullDescription: Test your problem-solving skills in this intense competitive programming contest featuring algorithmic challenges of varying difficulty levels.

guidelines.title: Ranking
guidelines.content: Based on problems solved and time taken

details.fullDescription: Present your cutting-edge projects and innovative solutions to industry experts and fellow students. This is your platform to shine and get recognized.

guidelines.title: Project Categories
guidelines.content: Web Development, Mobile Apps, IoT, AI/ML, Hardware

guidelines.title: Setup
guidelines.content: Participants must bring their own laptops/devices

details.fullDescription: Unleash your creativity in this UI/UX design competition where you'll create stunning user interfaces and experiences for real-world problems.

guidelines.title: Tools
guidelines.content: Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, or any design tool

guidelines.title: Theme
guidelines.content: Problem statement revealed on the day

guidelines.title: Evaluation
guidelines.content: Creativity, Usability, Visual Appeal, User Experience

details.fullDescription: Challenge yourself with a comprehensive quiz covering various domains of computer science and emerging technologies. Perfect for testing your technical acumen.

guidelines.title: Topics
guidelines.content: Programming, Algorithms, OS, Networks, Database, Current Tech

guidelines.title: Guidelines
guidelines.content:
Each team consists of two participants.
 The competition is conducted through 2 rounds. 
 First round will be MCQ and the second is buzzer round.
Malpractice or any misconduct will lead to disqualification.
The authority has full rights to make any changes to the program.

guidelines.title: Round 1
guidelines.content:
Each team would be given a set of question papers containing 25 objective type questions (MCQ).
The time limit of 1st round is 30 mins.
Marks will be given for each correct answer.
There will be no negative marking.
5 questions will be starred.
In case of a tie between 2 or more teams, the team that has correctly answered the most number of starred questions will advance into next level.
The top 8 scoring teams will qualify for the next round.

guidelines.title: Round 2 : KNOCKOUT
guidelines.content:
The 8 qualifying teams will compete in a knockout format.
Matches will be held one team against another.
Each team must compete against and defeat an opponent in a head-to-head match to advance to the next round.
Each match will consist of a set of buzzer questions.
The winners of each stage will proceed to the next stage until the final.
In case of a tie, a tie-breaker question will be asked.
